descriptionPreview.en: A short test tour around Milan's historic center for GPS testing
descriptionPreview.it: Un breve tour di prova nel centro storico di Milano per test GPS

completionMessage.en: Test tour completed! Great job testing the GPS system.
completionMessage.it: Tour di prova completato! Ottimo lavoro nel testare il sistema GPS.

points.title: Piazza del Duomo
points.description: Welcome to the magnificent Piazza del Duomo, the heart of Milan. The cathedral took nearly six centuries to complete and is one of the largest churches in the world.

points.title: Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II
points.description: You are now approaching Italy's oldest active shopping mall. Built in the 1860s, this stunning arcade connects Piazza del Duomo with Piazza della Scala.

points.title: Teatro alla Scala
points.description: Welcome to La Scala, one of the world's most famous opera houses. Since 1778, this theatre has hosted premieres of works by Verdi, Puccini, and Rossini.

points.title: Castello Sforzesco
points.description: You've reached the Sforza Castle, a 15th-century fortress that now houses several of Milan's museums and art collections, including Michelangelo's final sculpture.

points.title: Parco Sempione
points.description: Congratulations on completing the test tour! You're now in Parco Sempione, Milan's largest city park, created in the 19th century as the gardens of the Sforza Castle.

notes: Points are 100-200m apart for easy walking tests
Trigger radii set to 120-150m for reliable GPS triggering
Route: Duomo → Galleria → La Scala → Castello → Sempione Park
Best tested during daylight hours with clear GPS signal

gpsTips.bestAccuracy: Open areas like Piazza del Duomo will have best GPS accuracy
gpsTips.challengingAreas: Galleria Vittorio Emanuele (covered arcade) may have reduced GPS accuracy
gpsTips.urbanCanyon: Narrow streets between points 2-3 may show GPS drift
gpsTips.recommendedTime: Test during off-peak hours for easier walking between points
